jobs.title: Mid Backend Engineer - Platform
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Jimdo

Join us to help unleash the power of the self-employed and help them thrive! 

Jimdo was founded by three school friends in 2007 in a farmhouse in Northern Germany. Fast forward to today, we’re a growing, profitable business with a team of 250+ people from 50 nationalities based in over 15 countries. Our portfolio serves the unique needs of microbusinesses. In addition to our GDPR-compliant website builder powered by AI, we offer an online store, legal text generator, business listings, social media integration, SEO, and more. We’re constantly developing new products and services that make the lives of microbusiness owners easier and help fuel their businesses. If you’re inspired by our mission and like the idea of working for a dynamic remote-first company where you can create impact from day 1, we’d love to meet you!

Role Overview :

At Jimdo, we are committed to providing innovative solutions that empower our users' creativity. Our backend systems are a cornerstone of this promise. As a Mid Backend Engineer, you'll play a pivotal role in strengthening and scaling these systems, ensuring they remain robust, efficient, and effective.

Your impact:

  • Design, develop, and optimize API services with a keen focus on scalability, reliability, and performance.

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, understanding requirements and ensuring that the backend solutions integrate seamlessly with other components.

  • Uphold a high standard of code quality through code reviews, testing, and adherence to best practices.

  • Diagnose and resolve backend issues, aiming for minimal downtime and optimum performance.

  • Stay updated with the latest industry trends, technologies, and best practices in backend development.

  • Provide insights and feedback to the Tech Lead and other stakeholders, ensuring the technical feasibility and timeline of backend solutions.

What you bring:

  • A minimum of 4+ years of experience in backend development.

  • Proficiency in Kotlin. Experience with Java is beneficial.

  • Hands-on experience with REST APIs, microservices architecture, and cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud.

  • Solid understanding of software architecture, design patterns, and best practices in backend development.

  • Strong problem-solving, analytical, and communication skills.

  • Ability to collaborate effectively within a team.

  • Familiarity with frontend technologies, specifically JavaScript, TypeScript, or React, is a plus but not required.

  • Background of building IAM solutions is a plus.

What we offer:

Inspiring Mission: At our core, we are driven by a meaningful mission - to  empower solopreneurs and small businesses to succeed and  to contribute to the sustainability and vibrancy of the communities they serve.

Flexibility and Trust: Our work environment thrives on flexibility and trust. We offer fully remote work set-up  with opportunities for in-person collaboration. You can manage your working hours flexibly because we prioritize the results you deliver over the number of hours you put in. 

Support for your side hustles: We encourage side hustles. In addition, you get up to three free Jimdo websites for your personal or professional projects that you get to keep forever.

An International Diverse Team: Our team is a mosaic of over 248 individuals hailing from 50+ different countries and working across 15+ diverse locations. We take pride in our openness and inclusivity, with an Employee-led DEI Council and active ERGs that ensure everyone's voices are heard.

Continuous  Growth and Career Development: We invest in your growth with company-wide access to LinkedIn Learning and Hack Weeks, Deep Work Thursdays, conferences and access to technical eLearning platforms. From day one, you have the chance to contribute your ideas and create a meaningful impact. Our flat hierarchies and swift decision-making processes provide an open platform for your career progression.

Competitive Benefits Package: 

  • Annual compensation reviews to ensure you're rewarded fairly.

  • A remote office set-up bonus to enhance your workspace.

  • A unique workation policy that allows you to work from different locations.

  • An employee assistance program, offering resources and counseling.

  • Plus, a perk that keeps giving: up to three free Jimdo websites for your personal or professional projects that you get to keep forever.

Jimdo is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. This means that we don’t discriminate based on race or ethnic origin, color, the language(s) you speak, where you (or your parents) are from, or whether or not you consider yourself to have a disability. Neither will your age, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, beliefs, or political opinions play a part in your application with us. Our diverse team values and celebrates the uniqueness of each individual. We embrace differences and believe that they enrich our organization, making us stronger and more innovative. Join us, and let's continue to create a workplace where everyone can thrive, regardless of background or identity.


By sending your application, you declare that you read and understand the Jimdo Applicant Privacy Policy

Fast forward to today, we’re a growing, profitable business with a team of 250+ people from 50 nationalities based in over 15 countries. Our portfolio serves the unique needs of microbusinesses. If you’re inspired by our mission and like the idea of working for a dynamic remote-first company where you can create impact from day 1, we’d love to meet you!

Role Overview :

We are a small team of security experts enabling Jimdo’s business, product, and engineering teams to build and operate our offerings securely. Our mission is to protect our people and assets from threats and to ensure secure business operations. Reporting to the Head of SecOps, you will be responsible for the implementation and adoption of critical security controls, managing vulnerabilities, and ensuring security best practices across Jimdo’s enterprise and cloud environments.

Your impact:

  • Support the Head of SecOps in operationalizing the Technical Security Strategy.

  • Implement security controls to ensure enforcement of policies and procedures.

  • Develop security standards for integration into the Jimdo technology environment.

  • Enhance cloud security posture management (AWS, EKS) and vulnerability remediation.

  • Automate security workflows, including vulnerability management and compliance checks.

  • Engage with teams to improve security control adoption and assurance.

  • Manage security controls assurance and post-incident remediation activities.

  • Build KPIs, dashboards, and security reports to track security effectiveness.

  • Act as a liaison with external vendors and ensure compliance with security standards.

What you bring:

  • 7+ years of experience in cybersecurity roles.

  • Relevant security certifications (GIAC, CISSP, CCSP, OSCP, etc.).

  • Strong knowledge of cloud security (AWS, Kubernetes, Infrastructure as Code).

  • Expertise in vulnerability management, threat analysis, and penetration testing.

  • Experience with automation and scripting (Python, Terraform, CI/CD).

  • Knowledge of security compliance frameworks (ISO 27001, SOC 2, GDPR).

  • Ability to communicate effectively with stakeholders and provide security guidance.

  • Experience in building security controls and assurance frameworks.

Our flat hierarchies and swift decision-making processes provide an open platform for your career progression.

Join us to help unleash the power of the self-employed and help them thrive! 

Jimdo was founded by three school friends in 2007 in a farmhouse in Northern Germany. Fast forward to today, we’re a growing, profitable business with a team of 250+ people from 50 nationalities based in over 15 countries. Our portfolio serves the unique needs of microbusinesses. In addition to our GDPR-compliant website builder powered by AI, we offer an online store, legal text generator, business listings, social media integration, SEO, and more. We’re constantly developing new products and services that make the lives of microbusiness owners easier and help fuel their businesses. If you’re inspired by our mission and like the idea of working for a dynamic remote-first company where you can create impact from day 1, we’d love to meet you!

Role Overview :

As a Senior Product Owner – Growth, you’ll own the end-to-end customer journey across Jimdo’s multi-product suite—including CMS, Flows, Booking, JimdoPay and beyond. Your mission: ensure our users discover, adopt, and grow with the right products at the right time. You'll blend classic product ownership with customer journey design to drive activation, retention, and lifetime value.

Your impact:

  • Own and optimize customer journeys across our multi-product ecosystem.

  • Design onboarding flows and dashboards that guide users intuitively.

  • Identify cross-sell and upsell opportunities via packaging and pricing flows.

  • Collaborate with lifecycle marketing to align messaging and product delivery.

  • Lead roadmap execution for journey-impacting initiatives.

  • Partner across engineering, design, data, and other Product Owners.

  • Use data and research to continuously improve activation, retention, and LTV.

What you bring:

  • 4+ years in Product Owner or Product Manager roles in SaaS or consumer-facing products.

  • Proven experience managing customer journeys, conversion funnels, or lifecycle metrics.

  • Experience with onboarding, adoption, and monetization flows (pricing, packaging, checkout).

  • Track record in multi-product environments (B2B, B2C, or B2B2C).

  • Familiarity with agile delivery and product lifecycle management.

What we offer:

Inspiring Mission: At our core, we are driven by a meaningful mission - to  empower solopreneurs and small businesses to succeed and  to contribute to the sustainability and vibrancy of the communities they serve.

Flexibility and Trust: Our work environment thrives on flexibility and trust. We offer fully remote work set-up  with opportunities for in-person collaboration. You can manage your working hours flexibly because we prioritize the results you deliver over the number of hours you put in.

Experience Design sits at the center of Jimdo’s user-centric mindset. As a Product Designer in the team, you’ll play a crucial role to help us deliver easy-to-use value to our customers. You’ll bring empathy to really understand our customers’ motivations and needs, and apply functional design principles to deliver best industry standard solutions. With the objective of unlocking success for Jimdo’s business, you will directly look after creating market demand, while bridging technical and business requirements.   • You excel in both product discovery and product delivery tracks. You apply industry best practices for continuous product discovery, and are proficient in adopting and contributing to Design Systems—mastery with Figma.

  • You have experience designing for both desktop and mobile industry standards, and are knowledgeable about Conversational and Assistive AI design models.

  • You have the ability to simplify complex business concepts into functional prototypes for rapid-testing and validation.

  • Integrate AI and automation into campaigns for personalization and efficiency

  • Design and execute experiments to optimize lifecycle performance
